content: warm neck & hands by andra asars never have a chilled neck or hands again this colorful merino cowl and fingerless mitts set is a quick and easy knit makes the perfect gift inspired by my lys owner marji and designed with the new knitter in mind finished measurements cowl 20 circumference 10 5 height fingerless mitts 6 circumference unstretched 9 5 long materials lang mille colori baby 845-0052 yarn amounts cowl 1 skein mitts 1 skein needles cowl us 16 circle #6 mitts us#4 dps stitch marker gauge cowl 6 sts/in and 8 row/in st st on #6 mitts 6 sts/in and 10 row/in in 1x1 rib on #4 unstretched abbreviations pm= place marker knitting cowl with #6 circular needle cast on 120 sts join round being careful to not twist pm purl one round knit one round continue knitting around stockinette stitch until about two yards of yarn remain bind off in purl fingerless mitts first divide the 50g skein into two equal balls i placed the skein in a bowl on a kitchen scale and wound off a ball until the scale measured 25g one 25g ball for each mitt the mitts are worked from the fingers up toward the forearm using size 4 dps cast on 70 sts divide evenly among needles work around in 1x1 ribbing knit 1 purl 1 until piece measures 2 stopping at beginning of round cast on tail marks the beginning make thumb hole by binding off ten stitches continue working ribbing around next round cast on ten stitches over the bound off stitches thereby creating the thumb hole work even in ribbing until about one yard is left bind off in rib make second mitt
